sen.j: 伊邪那岐神社（いざなぎじんじゃ）は奈良県北葛城郡上牧町にある神社である。
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shirine is located in Kanmaki-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Kanmaki-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture: http://yubin.senmon.net/search/?q=奈良県上牧
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shirine is located in Kanmaki-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Izanagi-jinja Shirine is located in Kanmaki-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 式内社で、旧社格は村社。
sen.e: It was a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) and was categorized as a sonsha (a village shrine) in the old shrine ranking.
It is a shikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) and was ranked as a sonsha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.
It is a shikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) and was ranked as a sonsha (village shrine) under the old shrine classification system.

sen.j: 片岡城の南端に位置する。
sen.e: It is located at the southern end of Kataoka-jo Castle.
It is located at the southern end of Kataoka-jo Castle.
It is located at the southern end of Kataoka-jo Castle.
Enshrined Deity
Enshrined Deity
Enshrined deity
sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字にしました。

sen.j: イザナギを主祭神とし、天児屋根命（春日神）・応神天皇（八幡神）・住吉三神・倉稲魂命（稲荷神）を配祀する。
sen.e: It enshrines Izanagi (The Male Who Invites) as a shusaijin (main enshrined deity), Amenokoyane no mikoto (Kasuga no kami), Emperor Ojin (Hachimanshin [God of War]), Sumiyoshi Sanjin (Sumiyoshi three deities) and Uganomitama no mikoto (Inari-shin [the god of harvest]) as associated gods.

The main enshrined deity is Izanagi (The Male Who Invites), and Amenokoyane no mikoto (Kasuga no kami), Emperor Ojin (Hachimanshin [God of War]), Sumiyoshi Sanjin (Sumiyoshi three deities) and Uganomitama no mikoto (Inari-shin [the god of harvest]) are associated gods.

The main enshrined deity is Izanagi (The Male Who Invites), and Amenokoyane no mikoto (Kasuga no kami), Emperor Ojin (Hachimanshin (God of War)), Sumiyoshi Sanjin (Sumiyoshi three deities) and Uganomitama no mikoto (Inari-shin (the god of harvest)) are associated gods.
History
History
History

sen.j: 創立の年代等は不詳である。
sen.e: The year of its establishment is unknown.
The time in which the shrine was founded is unknown.
The time in which the shrine was founded is unknown.

sen.j: 文献の初出は、『日本三代実録』貞観 (日本)元年（859年）正月27日条、従五位上の神階を授けるという記述である。
sen.e: The first appearance in literature was in the Article from the 27th of January, 859 of the "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) stating that it was given the divine rank of the Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.

The first written reference to the shrine was in the article from the 27th of January, 859 in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) stating that it was given the divine rank of Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.

The first written reference to the shrine was in the article from the 27th of January, 859 in "Nihon Sandai Jitsuroku" (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts) stating that it was given the divine rank of Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では「大和国葛下郡 伊射奈岐神社」と記載され、小社に列格している。
sen.e: It is listed as 'Izanagi-jinja Shrine in Katsuraginoshimonokori, Yamato Province' in Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) and is categorized as a small shrine.
It is listed as 'Izanagi-jinja Shrine in Katsuraginoshimonokori, Yamato Province' in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) and is categorized as a small shrine.
It is listed as 'Izanagi-jinja Shrine in Katsuraginoshimonokori, Yamato Province' in the Engishiki Jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) and is categorized as a small shrine.

sen.j: かつては東方の忍山にあったが、片岡城築城の際に守護神として当地へ移ったと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said to have been relocated from Oshiyama in the east to its current location as a guardian god when Kataoka-jo Castle was built.
sen.cmt: 忍山が地名であるのか山であるのかが不明なため、地名として訳してあります。
sen.e: It is said to have been relocated from Oshiyama in the east to its current location as a guardian god when Kataoka-jo Castle was built.
It is said to have been relocated from Oshiyama in the east to its current location as a guardian god when Kataoka-jo Castle was built.

sen.j: 江戸時代までは五社明神（五社の宮）と称していた。
sen.e: It was referred to as Gosha Myojin (Gosha no miya) until the Edo period.
It was referred to as Gosha Myojin (Gosha no miya) until the Edo period.
It was referred to as Gosha Myojin (Gosha no miya) until the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治7年（1875年）に村社に列格し、明治40年（1907年）に神饌幣帛料供進社に指定された。
sen.e: It was categorized as a sonsha in 1875 and was designated as Shinsenhei hakuryo kyoshinsha in 1907.
It was categorized as a sonsha in 1875 and was designated as Shinsenhei hakuryo kyoshinsha in 1907.
It was categorized as a sonsha in 1875 and was designated as Shinsenhei hakuryo kyoshinsha in 1907.
Directions
Access
Access

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道和歌山線畠田駅から徒歩15分
sen.e: A 15-minute walk from Hatakeda Station on the JR West Wakayama Line.
A 15-minute walk from Hatakeda Station on the JR West Wakayama Line.
A 15-minute walk from Hatakeda Station on the JR West Wakayama Line.
